intro: Schizoloma ensifolium var. intercedens, commonly known as the narrow-leafed schizoloma, is a rare and specialized plant species native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves that are typically arranged in a basal rosette, with a distinctive silvery or grayish pubescence on the leaf surfaces. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in umbels, often appearing in late spring or early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests or rocky crevices, where it forms dense mats or low-growing colonies. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species, with conservation efforts focused on protecting its natural habitat from degradation.
